CatDescriptText: Mr. John Burnett, porter, 24 Tannehill Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "They should push so that everybody will be together. To segregate somebody dead, well, that's a mess."
TitMainTitle: Partial double exposure, portrait of John Burnett wearing hat and jacket with herringbone sleeves and collar
